title: Like rings on water
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Alternative lifestyles
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Alternative lifestyles
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/City planning - Social aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Cities and towns - Growth - Social aspects
description: Discusses the problems of traffic congestion in large cities, and advocates a theory of town planning with effective decentralisation. Suggests a complex of small centres around a larger focal point. Although people naturally gravitate to cities most of their activities could be just as well performed in a more rural setting which could also allow for more freedom, individualism and fresh air.
